issue.title: intermittent TSAN failure in lockmanager_tests::blockmanager_readblock_hash_mismatch
issue.body:
TSAN failure (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/actions/runs/16651908244/job/47126650397?pr=32989#step:8:6056): 
```bash
2025-07-31T14:39:40.396402Z [test] [net.cpp:2419] [void CConnman::SetTryNewOutboundPeer(bool)] [net] setting try another outbound peer=false
2025-07-31T14:39:40.396438Z [test] [net.cpp:3192] [void==================
WARNING: ThreadSanitizer: data race (pid=11584)
  Write of size 8 at 0x7234000016f0 by main thread:
```

_Originally posted by @fanquake in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/32989#issuecomment-3140270122_

events.body:
A bit odd that this only happens in the pull changing the CI system, but it seems to be frequent: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32989#issuecomment-3160730521

It would be good to look into this, so I created this issue.
Not sure if this will fix it, but avoiding mutating shared state is desirable anyway - pushed https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33154

> A bit odd that this only happens in the pull changing the CI system, but it seems to be frequent: [#32989 (comment)](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32989#issuecomment-3160730521)

This makes me suspicious of this commit in #32989: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32989/commits/636b611781154f32c8d7ae8ea301d12b1464c151

I think I'll drop that for now over in that PR, as it was originally added as an "optional optimisation", but I wonder if it could be contributing to this issue...
